Artisan Bread Workshops

Learn the ancient art of sourdough baking in our traditional wood-fired oven with expert guidance and local ingredients

Traditional Bread Making Workshop

Master the timeless craft of artisan bread making using traditional techniques passed down through generations. Learn to work with our heritage wood-fired oven and create delicious sourdough using local, organic ingredients.

Workshop Process

Step 1: Introduction & Ingredients
Learn about sourdough starter and select organic flours
Step 2: Mixing & Kneading
Master traditional hand-kneading techniques
Step 3: First Rise
Learn fermentation timing while enjoying refreshments
Step 4: Shaping & Scoring
Shape your loaves and create decorative scoring patterns
Step 5: Wood-Fired Baking
Bake in our authentic stone oven using traditional methods
Step 6: Tasting & Take-Home
Enjoy fresh bread with local butter and take loaves home

What's Included

  • 4-hour hands-on workshop
  • All organic ingredients provided
  • Expert instruction & guidance
  • Traditional wood-fired oven experience
  • Sourdough starter to take home
  • 2-3 fresh loaves per person
  • Recipe cards and baking guide
  • Light refreshments during workshop
  • Apron and all tools provided

Skill Levels Welcome

Complete Beginner
Never baked bread before? Perfect! We start with the basics.
Home Baker
Have some experience? Learn professional techniques and wood-fired methods.
Advanced Baker
Experienced baker? Master traditional fermentation and artisan shaping.

Workshop Benefits

  • Learn sustainable, traditional baking methods
  • Understand fermentation and timing
  • Master wood-fired oven techniques
  • Take home starter for ongoing baking
  • Connect with local food traditions
  • Enjoy therapeutic, hands-on activity
